intro: Hieracium parcidentatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium parcidentatum is a perennial species that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
